Lachen is 121 kms from Gangtok through the North Sikkim Highway. The road from Gangtok passes Phodong and Mangan. At Chungthang the road bifurcates, the road on the right leading to Lachung and the one on the left going to Lachen. It is a 6 hrs drive from Gangtok to Lachen.

Lachen is covered as part of North Sikkim Package tours. This is the transit point for visiting Gurudongmar lake. This lake is the 2nd highest lake in India. Restricted area permit is required to visit this lake.

Temperature is below 10 degrees through the whole year and below freezing point in winter and at night. If you want to visit Chopta valley you have to stay overnight at Lachen. The drive from Lachen to Thangu is 30 kilometers with a difference in altitude of about 4 500 feet. The green vegetation of the lower altitudes changes to an Alpine and finally to a Tibetan plateau type terrain. Indian citizens are allowed to proceed to Gurudongmar Lake, but foreigners may visit Chopta Valley only.
